description:
The Manager MLOps (Machine Learning Operations) is responsible for overseeing the MLOps/industrialized ML function across NFCU cloud to ensure the machine learning productionalization process is reliable, efficient, automatable, and scalable. Manages team of Machine Learning Engineers and coordinates all borrowed resources in MLOps. Oversees design and management of ML ETL processes, architecture, and all aspects of the model productionalization and monitoring. Partner and coordinate with internal stakeholders to understand business and technical needs. Communicate and present complex analytics results and concepts to leadership and internal stakeholders. Regarded as expert on cutting edge research for MLOps, ML, and AI technology and concepts, especially leveraging cloud technologies. Conduct highly complex work with extensive latitude for independent judgment.
Responsibilities:
o Lead the MLOps function across NFCU cloud to ensure the machine learning productionalization process is reliable, efficient, automatable, and scalable o Drive machine learning ETL pipeline design, architecture, data modeling, and machine learning at scale via CI/CD o Manage team of ML Engineers and MLOps pod borrowed resources to code and develop software that deploys advanced machine learning models and algorithms into production, perform data ETL, statistical and analytical analyses, and communicate insights and recommendations to internal and external clients o Oversee complex algorithmic analysis to optimize runtime performance and other improvements o Maintain best practices for software engineering for data applications across MLOps with an emphasis on statistical modeling, machine learning, advanced analytics, and/or Artificial Intelligence o Develop new capabilities and utilities to ensure MLOps can leverage increasing economies of scale across the end-to-end ML lifecycle and from an enterprise-wide perspective o Evangelize the MLOps framework and capability across the enterprise to ensure NFCU is driving toward becoming an AI powered organization o Stay abreast of latest AI/ML/analytics trends and technologies; recognized as an expert o Provide AI/ML Engineering thought leadership including technical direction to AI/ML Engineering practitioners as well as strategic input regarding enterprise applications and considerations o Lead the development of continuous monitoring frameworks for models in production including measure of feature/model drift as well as responsible/ethical AI and model risk measures o Facilitate the creation of a data-driven culture, driving business decisions via insights from data o Identify, compare, and develop technologies to address new enterprise needs, especially around performing machine learning at scale o Oversee the preparation of high quality project deliverables that are valued by the business and present them in such a manner that they are easily understood by project stakeholders o Plan and maintain MLOps backlogs and sprints o Provide expert ad-hoc support for complex challenges and issues related to spark o Drive change and take ownership of new initiatives related to MLOps applications and process improvements o Document and communicate changes within the infrastructure o Perform other duties as assigned Qualifications and Education Requirements:
o Master's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or the equivalent combination of education, training, and experience o Experience leading team of ML Engineers, managing ML model deployment via CI/CD o Extensive background in machine learning, distributed systems design, statistics, or quantitative analysis o Expert knowledge of current AI and ML technologies and concepts as well as expert knowledge of data engineering domain o Proficient in Spark, Python, PySpark, Spark ML, and/or Scala o Advanced knowledge of Apache Spark, Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps, Azure Machine Learning, Hadoop, Hive (Apache), Informatica, Microsoft Azure, Databricks, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft SQL Server, MS Office Products or Operational Data Integration (OLTP) o Strong understanding of Spark Clusters, Spark Cluster UI, Dags, Ganglia Metrics and Spark logs to analyze and optimize spark jobs and clusters. o Expert knowledge of software and custom configurations to manage the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle (e.g., mlflow) and ability to stay current on new developments in rapidly evolving field o Experience leading, shaping, and developing innovative solutions while managing business risks o Advanced skill in translating business requirements into detailed AI/ML and analytics requirements o Advanced ability to communicate effectively about AI/ML with a broad range of audiences, from sophisticated technical resources to those with little or no relevant background o Project management skills and/or experience working in Agile project management o Demonstrates change management and/or excellent communication skills o Advanced data visualization skills Desired Qualifications and Education Requirements:
o In-depth knowledge and experience in Banking/Finance/Investments, familiar with terminology, concepts and business processes and systems o Familiarity with industry standards and regulations
Salary Range:
$100K -- $150K
Minimum Qualification
Data Science & Machine Learning, Technology ManagementEstimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.
